trans-unit.source: Locates and lists files in the directory specified by the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Path"></xref> property at run time.
Use this control to display a list of files selected by file type.
You can create dialog boxes in your application that, for example, enable the user to select a file or group of files.

If you also display the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox> controls, you can write code to synchronize them with the `FileListBox` control and with each other.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> class.
A `FileListBox` displays a list of files in a given directory at run time.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control displays files that have `Archive` attributes.

Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control, based on standard `Archive` file attribute used in the operating environment.
Setting this property in code at run time resets the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.
`true` if files that have the `Archive` attribute will be displayed; otherwise `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets the data source for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.

This property should not be set for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control; it is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>.

An object that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IListSource"></xref> interfaces, such as a <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the property to display for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.

This property should not be set for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control; it is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>.

A `String` that represents the name of an object property that is contained in the collection specified by the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.DataSource"></xref> property.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets the file name of the selected file in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref>.
Setting the `FileName` property at run time will result in only that file being displayed in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox>.
A `String` that contains the file name of the selected file.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control displays files that have `Hidden` attributes.

Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control, based on standard `Hidden` file attribute used in the operating environment.
Setting this property in code at run time resets the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.
`true` if files that have the `Hidden` attribute will be displayed; otherwise `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the height of an item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref>.

This property is not required for the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control; the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> does not support items of variable height.
It is provided only because the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control inherits from <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref>.
Gets the items that are contained in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref>.
This property should not be used for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox> control; trying to add or remove directories from the collection could cause an exception.
It is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.ObjectCollection"></xref> representing the items in the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox"></xref>.
Gets the items that are contained in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref>.
This property should not be used for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox> control; trying to add or remove directories from the collection could cause an exception.
It is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>.
An `Integer` representing the index of the item.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.ObjectCollection"></xref> that represents the items in the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control displays files that have `Normal` attributes.

Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control, based on standard `Normal` file attribute used in the operating environment.
Setting this property at run time resets the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.
`true` if files that have the `Normal` attribute will be displayed; otherwise `false`.
The default is `true`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoubleClick"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The `OnDoubleClick` method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.PathChange"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The `OnPathChange` method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.PatternChange"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The `OnPatternChange` method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.SelectedIndexChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The `OnSelectedIndexChanged` method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets the current path for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref>.
The value of the `Path` property is a string indicating a path, such as C:\Ob or C:\Windows\System.
For a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control, the default is the current path when the control is created at run time.
Use this property when you are building an application's file-browsing and manipulation capabilities.
Setting the `Path` property has effects similar to the MS-DOS `chdir` command; relative paths are allowed with or without a drive specification.
Specifying only a drive with a colon (:) selects the current directory on that drive.
The `Path` property can also be set to a qualified network path without a drive connection using the following syntax:
Changing the value of `Path` for a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control generates an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.PathChange> event.
A `String` that contains the current path, not including the file name.

Occurs when the path is changed by setting the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName"></xref> or <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Path"></xref> property in code.
You can use a `PathChange` event procedure to respond to path changes in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control.

When you assign a string that contains a new path to the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName%2A> property, the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control invokes the `PathChange` event.
Gets or sets a value indicating the file names displayed in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control at run time.
The `Pattern` property plays a key role in designing an application's file-browsing and manipulation capabilities.
Use `Pattern` in combination with other file-control properties to give the user ways to explore files or groups of similar files.
For example, in an application dedicated to starting other programs, you could designate that only .exe files be displayed in the file list box (*.exe).
In addition to using wildcard characters, you can also use multiple patterns separated by semicolons (;).
For example, "*.exe; *.bat" would return a list of all executable files and all MS-DOS batch files.
Changing the value of the `Pattern` property generates a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.PatternChange> event.
A string expression indicating a file specification, such as "*.\*" or "\*.FRM".
The default is "\*.\*", which returns a list of all files.

Occurs when the file listing pattern, such as "*.\*", is changed by setting the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName"></xref> or <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Pattern"></xref> property in code.
You can use a `PatternChange` event procedure to respond to pattern changes in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control.

When you assign a string that contains a new pattern to the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName%2A> property, the FileListBox invokes the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.PathChange> event.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control contains files that have read-only attributes.
Use the `ReadOnly` property for a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control to specify whether files that have read-only attributes are displayed in the file list or not.

If the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Normal%2A> property is set to `true` (the default), files that have read-only attributes are displayed regardless of the `ReadOnly` property setting.
`true` if files that have the `ReadOnly` attribute will be displayed; otherwise `false`.
The default is `true`.
Forces the control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself.
Gets a value indicating whether the items in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> are sorted alphabetically.
For the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control, `Sorted` always returns `false`.
`true` if items in the control are sorted; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox"></xref> control displays files that have `System` attributes.

Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control, based on standard `System` file attribute used in the operating environment.
Setting this property at run time resets the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.
`true` if files that have the `System` attribute will be displayed; otherwise `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets the property to use as the actual value for the items in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.

This property should not be set for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control; it is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>.

A `String` representing the name of an object property that is contained in the collection specified by the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.DataSource"></xref> property.
The default is an empty string ("").
